column4: I am desperately in need of help. My colleague using a windows machine wants to see my ubuntu desktop. I googled and found that tighvnc was the software to use. However, after installing it and typing in my ip address which starts with 192.168..... my friend gets the message that the connection cannot be established
well, if your friend is outside of your LAN, then it won't work that way
alternatively, your router's page should tell you your global ip
oh, another thing that might help is making sure that upnp is enabled on your router
I am bit ignorant on this: how can I go to my routers webpage
I typed in 192.168.1.1 in my browser but I got the message Problem loading page
did whatismyip not work for you?
i failed to realise that the IP address was given in the top itself for whatismyip
haha, that's ok. so you found it?
no, as long as you have upnp enabled on your router, it should be fine
what does your machine say your ip is?
